data.title: CONTENTdm
data.meta_description: Bryan Tolar, 52, was born in Dillon, South Carolina and grew up in northeast Columbia. In 1989, he earned a journalism degree from the University of South Carolina. Tolar joined the National Guard at the age of 26 in the early 1990s and he has served for 26 years. Currently, he is an Operations Officer. Interview includes discussion of Tolar's family history, his decision to join the National Guard, and his time spent serving in Bosnia and Afghanistan. Tolar also discussed his work with organizations like the American Legion and programs like Richland Northeast High School's ""Valentine's for Vets,"" which brings students and veterans together. Tolar also reflected on his son's decision to join the military.
